types.name: Query
types.description: Details the queries available in Hunterer v2

fields.name: magicCards
fields.description: Search against the database of MagicCards

fields.name: magicCardPrintings
fields.description: Search against the database of MagicCardPrintings

fields.name: magicCard
fields.description: query to fetch a card by id.

fields.name: autoCard
fields.description: query to fetch a card by name , setAbbreviation, language

fields.name: randomCard
fields.description: query to fetch a random MagicCard.

fields.name: magicCardSets
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard setNames in English.

fields.name: magicCardOracleSubTypes
fields.description: query to fetch all MagicCard subTypes in English.

types.name: MagicCardFilterInput
types.description: Provides filters and operators to search against the database of MagicCards This is the required argument type for the magicCards query field

types.name: LogicalOperatorFilter
types.description: An input type for specifying the logical operator and terms to evaluate cards by

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: LogicalRarityInput
types.description: An input type for specifying the logical operator and terms to evaluate the rarity of a card

types.name: MagicCardRarity
types.description: Magic cards rarity

types.name: LogicalManaCostInput
types.description: An input type for specifying the logical operator and terms to evaluate the Mana Cost of a card

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: RangeFilterInput
types.description: An input type to evaluate cards by a range of integers

types.name: PrintedLanguage
types.description: The language used on the card

types.name: LogicalLegalitiesInput
types.description: An input type for specifying the logical operator and terms to evaluate the legalities of a card

types.name: SortOrder
types.description: Order in which magic cards can sorted

enumValues.name: ASC
enumValues.description: ascending order

enumValues.name: DESC
enumValues.description: descending order

types.name: MagicCardSortCriteria
types.description: Magic card attribtes on which sorting can be performed

enumValues.name: ARTISTS
enumValues.description: sort based on first name of artist in order

enumValues.name: CHRONOLOGICAL
enumValues.description: sort based on release date chronological order

enumValues.name: NAME
enumValues.description: sort based on first word of card title

enumValues.name: COLLECTORNUMBER
enumValues.description: sort based on collectorNumber

enumValues.name: POWER
enumValues.description: sort based on Power

enumValues.name: TOUGHNESS
enumValues.description: sort based on toughness

enumValues.name: CONVERTEDMANACOST
enumValues.description: sort based on converted manna cost

enumValues.name: COLOR
enumValues.description: sort based on Color

enumValues.name: RARITY
enumValues.description: sort based on Rarity

fields.name: magicCards
fields.description: The MagicCard objects that were found, after applying limit and offset pagination parameters

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: The number of results returned for this page of the search; will always be equal to or less than the limit specified on the query

fields.name: totalPages
fields.description: The total number of results for this search that exist in the data store. Includes all results, not just those returned on this page

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results before this page

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results beyond the end of this page

fields.name: totalResults
fields.description: The total number of results for this search

types.name: SearchResult
types.description: This interface formalizes the API's mechanism for pagination to guarantee that is the same across different kinds of searches

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: The number of results returned for this page of the search; will always be equal to or less than the limit specified on the query

fields.name: totalPages
fields.description: The total number of results for this search that exist in the data store.Includes all results, not just those returned on this page

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results before this page

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results beyond the end of this page

fields.name: totalResults
fields.description: The total number of results for this search

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: MagicCard
types.description: A Magic: The Gathering card. It's the object that includes all of the latest rulings and legalities, as well as the official card rules text

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique ID for the card

fields.name: colors
fields.description: A card is the color or colors of the mana symbols in its mana cost, regardless of the color of its frame

fields.name: convertedManaCost
fields.description: The converted mana cost of the card

fields.name: faces
fields.description: All Magic cards have at least one face, and most have exactly one. Multi-faced cards do exist, however: some are double-sided, and some even have more than two sides. This field will be null unless isMultiFace is true

fields.name: isMultiFace
fields.description: Whether this card has more than one face. This is true for double-sided cards

fields.name: relationType
fields.description: The relationType of a card if it is Multi Faced.

fields.name: legalities
fields.description: An array of objects listing whether the card is banned, restricted, suspended, or legal in each MagicFormat

fields.name: loyalty
fields.description: The loyalty of the card, if any.

fields.name: manaCost
fields.description: The mana cost of the card

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the card. With very few exceptions, card names are unique

fields.name: oracleText
fields.description: The latest official rules text of the card, if any

fields.name: power
fields.description: The power of the card, if any. Usually a number, but may be a different symbol

fields.name: printings
fields.description: A list of the physical card printings of this card. If you only need the most recent printing of the card, use the latestPrinting field itself, as retrieving that data is more performant

fields.name: latestPrinting
fields.description: The most recent physical printing of this card

fields.name: rulings
fields.description: Any rulings that have been made concerning this card

fields.name: subtypes
fields.description: A list of the subtypes that the card bears

fields.name: supertypes
fields.description: A list of the supertypes that the card bears

fields.name: toughness
fields.description: The toughness of the card, if any. Usually a number, but may be a different symbol

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of the types that the card bears

fields.name: printing
fields.description: A specific printing of a card returned if setAbbreviation and language filters are passed in

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: MagicCardFace
types.description: A MagicCardFace object contains fields that can vary for each face of a multi-faced card

types.name: MagicManaCost
types.description: The string representation of a Magic card mana cost

types.name: MagicCardLegality
types.description: An object that tracks a particular card's legal status in a particular format

fields.name: cardId
fields.description: The ID of the card

fields.name: format
fields.description: Different format types in which a magic game can be played

fields.name: legalStatus
fields.description: The legal status of the card in the format

types.name: MagicFormat
types.description: Different format types in which a magic game can be played

fields.name: id
fields.description: The type-specific unique identifier of this Format

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the Format

types.name: MagicCardLegalStatus
types.description: Magic cards legality status

types.name: MagicCardPrinting
types.description: This type contains information about a card that is specific to a printing of that card

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique ID for the card printing

fields.name: artistCredit
fields.description: The artist credit line, if any

fields.name: collectorNumber
fields.description: The collector number of the card in this printing. Usually but not always a number

fields.name: colors
fields.description: A card is the color or colors of the mana symbols in its mana cost, regardless of the color of its frame

fields.name: convertedManaCost
fields.description: The converted mana cost of the card

fields.name: manaCost
fields.description: The mana cost of the card

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the card. With very few exceptions, card names are unique

fields.name: power
fields.description: The power of the card, if any. Usually a number, but may be a different symbol

fields.name: toughness
fields.description: The toughness of the card, if any. Usually a number, but may be a different symbol

fields.name: rarity
fields.description: The rarity of the card

fields.name: thumbnailImageUrl
fields.description: A URL of a low-resolution image that represents the card printing

fields.name: fullImageUrl
fields.description: A URL of a high-resolution image that represents the card printing

fields.name: printedText
fields.description: The text as it appears on the card. May differ from the card's normative Oracle text

fields.name: printedFlavorText
fields.description: The flavor text as it appears on the card

fields.name: set
fields.description: The set in which the card was printed

fields.name: legalities
fields.description: An array of objects listing whether the card is banned, restricted, suspended, or legal in each MagicFormat

fields.name: watermark
fields.description: Watermarks on a card printing

fields.name: supertypes
fields.description: A list of the supertypes that the card bears

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of the types that the card bears

fields.name: subtypes
fields.description: A list of the subtypes that the card bears

fields.name: languageCode
fields.description: Languages that a card was printed in

types.name: MagicCardSet
types.description: A Magic Card Set represents a collection set of magic cards

fields.name: id
fields.description: The type-specific unique identifier of this card set

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the set

fields.name: abbreviation
fields.description: The abbreviation of the set name

fields.name: releaseDate
fields.description: When the set was released

types.name: DateTime
types.description: An ISO8601 date in the form YYYY-MM-DD

types.name: MagicRuling
types.description: A ruling is a clarification or addendum to the Magic rules that is specific to a particular Magic card

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the ruling

fields.name: magicCardId
fields.description: The ID of the card this ruling applies to

fields.name: publicationDate
fields.description: The date on which the ruling was published

fields.name: text
fields.description: The text of the ruling

types.name: MagicCardPrintingFilterInput
types.description: Provides filters and operators to search against the database of MagicCards.This is the required argument type for the magicCards query field

fields.name: magicCardPrintings
fields.description: The MagicCardPrinting objects that were found, after applying limit and offset pagination parameters

fields.name: currentPage
fields.description: The number of results returned for this page of the search; will always be equal to or less than the limit specified on the query

fields.name: totalPages
fields.description: The total number of results for this search that exist in the data store. Includes all results, not just those returned on this page

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results before this page

fields.name: hasNextPage
fields.description: Whether there exist search results beyond the end of this page

fields.name: totalResults
fields.description: The total number of results for this search

types.name: magicCardSets
types.description: All set information of MagicCards

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the set

fields.name: abbreviation
fields.description: The abbreviation of the set name

types.name: magicCardOracleSubType
types.description: All oracle subTypes of MagicCards

fields.name: subTypes
fields.description: A card is the color or colors of the mana symbols in its mana cost, regardless of the color of its frame

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax (as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).
